However, we’re happy to say that Joyce has been with us for more than 25 years!  She has received the title of Service Champion and won the 2013 WSQ Outstanding Alumni Award. We couldn’t be more proud of you Joyce!

12.post_text:
Here’s another reason to get up and go! Starting today, you can swop your regular English muffins for our new wholegrain muffins at no extra cost! Specially formulated so that they are similar in appearance, softness and taste to our regular muffins, each wholegrain muffin contains approximately half a recommended serving* of whole grains, making it easier for you to add more whole grains to your diet.
 
*The Health Promotion Board recommends 2-3 servings of whole grains per day.

15.post_text: We are giving three young football lovers the chance to fly to Brazil to watch the 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil™ ‘live’ and walk out onto the pitch as a Player Escort! To enter, submit a short video (3 mins or less) or a photo (no more than 1MB and accompanied by a write-up of up to 150 words) featuring you and your child and tell us why your kid should be chosen. Email your entries to stsportscontest@sph.com.sg by 5pm, March 30. Good luck! Visit www.mcdonalds.com.sg/PEPTC for the full list of terms and conditions.

I feel so cheated by the staff at McDonald's tradehub 21. Was so happy that I had a free hash brown and a burger for the past 2 days. When I went to the counter and showed the staff the first redemption she proceeded with the purchase but I also asked her for the burger and showed her. She suddenly tells me I can only claim 1 per day which was not even said anywhere!!! Now I have just wasted a redemption. She din even have the courtesy to tell me before I click the redeem button..

Totally agreed! the staff was totally rude when I went with the coupons not only at one outlet but almost all that I went to!! 
One china staff tot I couldn't understand chinese coz I keep talking to him in English he told another china staff saying 'tsk come here take free stuff de la'... 

And since you guys in mac are not even giving a damn but our feedback, I rather have BK now...

This is not the first time this happened at this outlet. It happened to my colleague too. If the staff is so unhappy with us redeeming stuff, would we feel happy eating it?

Are you at all serious about your BREAKFAST line of products? Do you value customer feedback? Your reply does NOTHING to make your customer feel better. Do you have ownership or responsibility over your McDonald Brand?

McDonald's Singapore: Dear Philip, we are truly sorry for your experience and thank you for your feedback. We will definitely flag it to our McDelivery team so that we can work on improving our service.

Oh and one more thing I was redeeming my Macgriddles when I pressed redeemed the counter didn't move then your staff pressed back to try again when the page refreshed the coupon was redeemed alrdy but the auntie didn't bother about me when I showed her my phone and served other customer!

I purchase happy meal and redeem for small fries immediately after that I show the counter staff I need to redeem the free apple pie that is without purchases.  To my surprise she say cannot one time only one redemption???

Counter Staff: China Pasar Malam lor...

Hey there, the coupons are really short-lived such that it expired this weekend, despite me having received one barely two days ago. Consumers are gonna need time to respond, and the app should accommodate them in some ways right? Do hope you guys would consider this in improving the app service.

My husband was at Marine Parade Macdonalds this evening.. Wanted to redeem his surprise wallet.. XS coke the staff wasn't sure of the app and decided to call the manager.. Manager said oh this is a 'fake program/promotion' by the manager ... "As if we are trying to cheat a small cup of Coke...
Ended up we have to show the manager the leaflet passed to us earlier on to prove our innocents ...
How do you feel as a customer on such case, when Mcd staff said their own program is fake..
Re-think about it we felt it might not be the manager's fault but problems with passing down of information...
Care to pass down to all branches proper information on this apps? And how to press FOC orders of surprise wallet into the cashier system, they don't seem to have an option for this promotion.. 
We won't want other customers to felt, how we felt... 
Trying to cheat a cup of XS coke..
Thank you..

22.post_text:
Hi everyone, 
This is an update to the incident that occurred yesterday when a customer visited our store with her guide dog. We managed to contact the customer earlier today, extended our apologies to her for her experience at our restaurant and clarified the situation.

We also offered to invite her back to the restaurant so that we may review what took place. She had declined and shared that she is not seeking any further action against members of our staff but awareness about guide dogs. We appreciate her gesture and hope to work closer with both her and the local Guide Dogs Association of the Blind to achieve this. 

Our policy is to be accepting of guide dogs and we will look into ways to strengthen our training efforts for our crew. We seek our customers’ support to help us create a guide-dog friendly environment. Thank you.

comments.message: They are so busy giving away the free burger, maybe they didnt realise a visually impaired person and shouted because too noisy? visually impaired person looks normal. Guide dog also looks like normal pet. Just a misunderstanding. Be kind and let it go...

C'mon mcd made a mistake, did the right thing by apologizing and counseling their staff. Just want to improve and move forward. Why boo them? What more do you want? For their heads to roll? Someone get fired and only then will you rest? I think what mcd did for this service recovery is commendable. It could happen to anybody. Those who booed mcd for trying to do their service recovery is worse than the staff that needs counseling. Be more tolerant when the party in qn has conceded and admitted their mistakes.

I hope that this message would go to all your outlets to prevent this incident from happening again. I do understand that many of your staff especially the elderly requires more training time so do keep it up!

And to supporters of Esme the Guide Dog, I'm sure you all are gracious enough to forgive and not post negative comments on this page. Don't assume that all people know about rules regarding guide dogs. I came to know about it during the Haagan Dazs incident only. McDonald's Singapore is giving free burgers so at least appreciate their effort.

McDonald's has already done their part by acknowledging and apologizing. Does commenting further help? Life goes on my fellow keyboard warriors. To criticize comment behind the screen is easy, to experience and confront to the staff working on the ground is not as easy as typing it all out.

First of all, I'm a visually impaired person but I don't own a guide dog.  I'm not against guide dogs. Guide dogs are generally very quiet and well-behaved.  I understand other people's concerns about animals in restaurants and other F&B establishments.  I also understand the need of a visually impaired person to be independent.  However, I feel that any visually impaired person with a guide dog should be considerate and sensitive towards other people too.  Although McDonald's and some other F&B establishments allow for guide dogs, the other patrons and customers may not share similar sentiments.  I get the point that Dillon Gaius Tan is trying to make.  I applaud McDonald's stand on this issue and the point I'm trying to make is that not only the general public need to be educated regarding the difference between a guide dog and a pet dog, the visually impaired person who own the guide dog also need to be reminded about animals in F&B establishments.

It is actually very easy to differentiate whether it's a guide dog or not. Special harness is fixed on the guide dog for the visually impaired person to hold on to. It is not a leash. On the harness there is even a sign saying that it is a guide dog.

Sadly. Many of the staff at macs work part time. Turn over rate is rather high.sacking the staff will not solve the problem. 

I think fundamentally is the character and attitude of us . Not saying that it is a good representation of us.

It could happen anywhere.
shouted at someone impaired. tsk tsk. Should sack that staff.

@dillon, so many questions asked by you. Perhaps you need to be in their shoes before making a selfish comments here. Guide dog are meant to assist visually impaired people which is the only method they need to rely on . let me ask you this question, did MCD forced you to dine in an environment that you dont like? You can make your own decision right?
Small matter blown out of proportion.

I think Berita Harian published a piece about how it's ok for Muslims to be around guide dogs. You can find it on Esme the guide dog's Facebook page. The only thing haram about dogs is their saliva, ya? So long you don't go up to a guide dog and stick your finger in their mouth, no worries about getting their saliva on you! ;) They're quite drool free.

Pls spare abit of compassion for the mcdonalds staff. They are not paid alot and still have to look out for guide dogs and provide perfect cust service. Honestly, i wouldnt be able to tell the difference unless the owner is really blind. And since pets are generally not allowed in restaurants, i wouldnt be surprised that the staff acted that way. Thank you Macdonalds for clarifying the matter. Im lovin' it!! :D
guide dogs are NOT pets!!!!! pls!!! they are fantastic working animals!! they are even better than some of those who can see!!!

Actually, guide dogs ARE more hygienic than regular pets, in the sense that they only poo or pee on command, they don't drool, and they don't lick or smell things without permission. As for shedding, labradors, the breed used most often for this purpose, do not shed that much. We probably drop about as much hair and skin flakes as they would shed fur, but you don't see me being disgusted by the next customer scratching himself or herself.

I think we need more education on Guide Dogs. Not everyone can tell the difference between Guide Dogs and normal pet dogs. Education is the key to solving this problem.

Unfortunately for Esme, there are only 3 Guide Dogs in Singapore. As we get more Guide Dogs in Singapore, people will slowly learn to tell the difference.

In the meantime, I think we also need to be more forgiving towards those who are ignorant about Guide Dogs. For those who don't know about Guide Dogs, this is a good time to slowly explain to them in a nice manner.

Hi Guys ... How about post something like ... "Thank you McDonalds for the FREE breakfast " !!!!  Thank you for organising this event , we really appreciated . 
Please do pardon the crew and the manager...they may not have knowledge about the disable ppl w guide dog . They made a mistake and apologised .

23.post_text:
Hi everyone,
 
We want to share about an incident that occurred today in one of our stores. You may have read comments online about a customer who visited us earlier today with her guide dog. One of our crew mistook the dog for a pet and advised her that no pets are allowed. Upon learning of this, the manager in charge of the restaurant immediately apologised and offered to assist the customer with her order.
 
We would like to clarify that McDonald’s welcomes guide dogs at our premises, and we have a standing policy to that effect. The comments of this particular crew member in no way represent our stand as a company and we sincerely apologise for any inconvenience this incident may have caused.
 
We will definitely counsel the staff member involved and reinforce our guidelines on assisting customers with guide dogs. This incident has also reminded us that many of our crew members may be unfamiliar with the distinction between a Guide Dog and a pet, and we are actively exploring ways to further educate our staff on this.
